disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 4 January to end of Wednesday 5 January GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Any cloud with rain or wintry showers will gradually clear east. Most parts turning sunny, however it will be feeling much colder than recent days, with brisk North winds. Maximum temperature 5 °C. <br/><br/>The brisk winds will likely ensure air pollution remains 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates. <br/><br/>With best wishes for the New Year from Imperial ERG.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 5 January to end of Wednesday 5 January GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A windy, cold start, but with some good sunny spells for much of the day. Winds will ease during the day, but still feeling cold. Maximum temperature 5 °C.<br/><br/>The brisk Northerly winds will likely ensure air pollution remains 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates. <br/><br/>With best wishes for the New Year from Imperial ERG.
